title: Introduction
data:
Welcome to CountryApp

CountryApp is a simple Blazor sample application that demonstrates how the Mendi.Blazor.DynamicNavigation NuGet package works in a real app. It lets you explore countries, view details, and navigate between pages using a fully dynamic, data-driven navigation menu.

What you can do with CountryApp:

  • Browse a list of countries and view key information
  • Navigate between pages using dynamic navigation built with the package
  • See how routes, labels, and icons can be defined from configuration
  • Use it as a reference for integrating dynamic navigation into your own app

Getting Started:

  1. Clone or download the CountryApp sample from the GitHub repository.
  2. Open the solution in Visual Studio or your preferred IDE.
  3. Restore NuGet packages, build the solution, and run the project.
  4. Explore the navigation menu to see how the dynamic navigation behaves at runtime.

Next Steps:

After exploring CountryApp, review the source code and configuration to see how the navigation items are defined and bound to Mendi.Blazor.DynamicNavigation. You can then adapt the same approach in your own application.

title: Using Mendi.Blazor.DynamicNavigation
data:
Mendi.Blazor.DynamicNavigation

Mendi.Blazor.DynamicNavigation is a Blazor library that helps you build dynamic, data-driven navigation menus (sidebars, headers, etc.) from configuration or backend data instead of hardcoding links.

Get Started

  1. Install the NuGet package: 
    dotnet add package Mendi.Blazor.DynamicNavigation
  2. Add the library to your Blazor application services in Program.cs and register the components in your layout.
  3. Configure your navigation items (for example JSON, database, or in code) and bind them to the dynamic navigation component.

GitHub Repository

For full installation instructions, examples, and source code, visit the GitHub repo:
https://github.com/danielmendie/Mendi.Blazor.DynamicNavigation

Tip:

Check the README and sample projects in the repository for ready-to-use configurations and best practices.
